intro: Centaurea baseri, commonly known as the Armenian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features striking blue to purple ray flowers surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Centaurea baseri is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
